What´s this good for?

ASCIImoji enables support for Unicode emoticons on every website your are visiting. To use them, just type the keywords as listed in the tables below into any text box on the web and ASCIImoji will convert it to the corresponding emoticon.

Settings

Here you can set the prefix and suffix needed to trigger the emoticon conversion. These settings are automatically updated when you change them (see the "You type" column in the tables below)

Your Custom Emoticons

Use the form below to add your own emoticons to the collection. You can also overwrite the built-ins by using keywords that are already used. Seperate multiple keywords with commas, like so: "hello,ohai,wave"
If the box "share" is checked, the developer will get an email with the keywords and emoticon you entered to include it in the next release.

You type You get
You haven´t defined any custom emoticons yet.

Built-in Emoticons

And finally, a list of all the built-in emoticons for your reference.

You type You get

Emoticons marked with a star ★ are interactive, that means you can change their default behaviour by giving them a parameter. For example (loading,70) will create a 70% filled loading bar. (fancytext,now this is fancy) will write "now this is fancy" in fancytext.
